item.title: Albert Westcott House: Suitcase dumped + sheet in trees, 31st August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ambergate Street, Elephant and Castle, London

item.title: Inciting hate, 31st August
item.description:
Dear Greenwich Council, We contact you with concerns about the increasing visibility of the St George’s and Union Jack flags, and they are beginning to stand for. The increasingly negative connotations associated with this flag are becoming more unsettling. It now appears to incite and celebrate hatred toward individuals of the minority. The painted red crosses and flags, in our view, this is vandalism, and we contact you to find out how you intend to address this issue. While I understand it is an incredibly difficult issue to resolve, surely some form of action is surely better than nothing. How do you intend to address the community and to discipline any incitement of hate? Our strength and clarity should shine through. By staying informed, standing tall with our values and refusing to be dragged down to their level, shows our communities dignity, knowledge and resilience to this matter. Surely we should speaker louder than hate? Please address the us all to encourage more peace and respect. With thanks, Residents in Greenwich Borough

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 362, Shooters Hill Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Figs and Grain grocery store dumps rubbish in council bins, 31st August
item.description:
Figs and Grain grocery store on Broadway Market regularly puts its commercial waste in the council housing bins (at the location marked). This consistently happens around closing time for the store.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ada Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Restaurant Blocking pavement with outdoor tables and chairs, 31st August
item.description:
The restaurant at 1 Broadway Market puts out too many tables and chairs on the weekends such that it is difficult to walk on the pavement between their seated patrons and the existing street furniture (electrical box and street lamp) on Regents Row.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Broadway Market, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smashed up abandoned car on street, 31st August
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Poole Road, Hackney, London
